title: Exercise 3-6
description: Fill in the missing numbers in the following (relative) frequency table for the gravity data:

questions.name: frequency_table
questions.html:
Class
Interval		Relative
Frequency
−160 to −1109%
−110 to −9010%
−90 to −70
−70 to −40
−40 to −10
−10 to 20
20 to 50
50 to 80
80 to 1602%
questions.description: The first missing entry is the percentage of values between −90 and −70. There are 13 data in that range: {−89, −87, −86, −83, −83, −80, −80, −79, −74, −74, −74, −71, −71}. Thirteen is 13% of 100, so the entry in the frequency table for the range −90 to −70 is 13%. Similarly, there are 20 observations in the range −70 to −40, so the corresponding entry in the frequency table is 20%. There are 25 observations in the range −40 to −10, so the corresponding entry is 25%. There are 14 observations between −10 and 20, so the corresponding entry is 14%. There are 5 observations between 20 and 50, so the corresponding entry is 5%. There are 2 observations between 50 and 80, so the corresponding entry is 2%. As a double check, we can add together all the percentages in the frequency table: they should total 100%. We have: 9% + 10% + 13% + 20% + 25% + 14% + 5% + 2% + 2% = 100%.
